content: alright guys I want to show you this
super easy way to fix your bones okay I got this guy with a staff all bent up
looks really goofy so now I'm gonna apply some heat from my heat gun and you
can actually start to see it Bend into place they're subtly you don't want to
put too much heat on it but enough that you can bend it and just hold it for
like a minute and bam look at that Wow totally fixed Wow so awesome and just
couldn't be easier so here's another one here and this guy's a really cool figure
but he's got a bent-over sword and his maces bent just so annoying
so now just apply some heat and you can see the sword go right back into place
actually actually over bend a bit so now just hold it for a minute and bam his
sword is fixed and he's got a bent mace - so we'll fix that even things like
this small you know that small handle you can fix just be careful with how
much heat you apply saw it bend it back back into place hold it and bam your
figure is fixed and you won't ever have to worry about it again so nice so much
easier than the hot water method the hot water method is so messy you know this
is so easy and this guy is a mess like I said his spear is you know awful bent
everywhere so we'll start with the end there and look that just almost bent
back in the place cuz that's where the miniature was molded it was molded that
shape and it wants to be in that shape but you know they this material is kind
of weird and it bends and there's just nothing more annoying than something
like this event spear right this ruins the miniature but with this heat gun you
can just fix this so easily and just check out my links below word he can get
this cheap heat gun and you can use it for lots of other crafts - not just
bending these miniatures back into shape so I just been the different parts of
the spear back in the shape and wow what a difference from when I first started
on this guy you just hold it Wow look at that totally awesome
hey see you guys next time happy crafting
